data.title: Goto symbol no longer works with AMD or module pattern with Salsa
data.body:
I am testing the latest VS Code insiders build (Version 0.10.10-insider (0.10.10-insider)). With the introduction of the new Salsa JS language service, "Goto symbol" no longer works for JS files with old module pattern (anonymous closure) or with AMD modules. I understand that, as documented, Salsa can't resolve AMD references, but it should recognise the symbols inside the file.

Here's an example how it works in the latest stable build:

![screen shot 2016-03-07 at 12 57 55](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10324676/13567580/b645f394-e464-11e5-9499-801bb63e52ec.png)

and here's with Salsa:

![screen shot 2016-03-07 at 12 57 37](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10324676/13567577/b413af4e-e464-11e5-8607-a3e1f3225c5c.png)

data.title: Support linking to localized licenses
data.body:
The Help > View License menu should redirect to the language currently being used in VS Code. We currently store the license url in `product.json`:

``` json
"licenseUrl": "http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=533485#vscode",
```

I don't know why we pass in #vscode here, I don't think its necessary.

The website will take an additional parameter `lang` with the three letter language code.  So, we need to append the language to the query, for example: `lang=deu`.

These are the supported languages: enu, ita, fra, esp, rus, chs, cht, jpn, kor, deu

data.title: (Windows) Uninstalling a symlinked extension deletes the target directory
data.body:
Reporting this since installing extensions via symbolic link may soon be coming to vsce (Microsoft/vscode-vsce#78). 

On Windows, when uninstalling an extension that was added to the .vscode/extensions folder via symbolic link, the contents of target folder of the link are deleted :open_mouth:, rather than just the link.

It's the same behaviour whether it's a symlink or a junction.

Tested on 10.8 and 10.10-insiders on Windows 8.1

data.title: [python] Wrong indentation in python files when declaring class

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When declaring class in python files, the next line should has indentation. For example:
- type `class Class:`
- hit Enter
- the cursor should be on position 4 (for indentation 4 spaces)

On the version  0.10.8 the cursor position is 0

data.title: Intellisense configuration through custom tasks
data.body:
Hi all

Is there a way to sync intellisense with custom build tasks? I am working in a TypeScript project, and as I understand it, Code reads the tsconfig.json to do its intellisense (among other things). However my compilation is done through a gulp task. This task reports errors for me and I've setup a problem matcher to catch those. The problem comes in however when there seems to be a mismatch between the service generating intellisense and the build process I am using. I can build my project for example (using the gulp task) and no errors will show up - however I can go to a file and see red squiggles under things that have no errors. Are there ways I can sync the intellisense with my tasks?

This is my tasks json:

```
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "gulp",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": [
         "--no-color"
    ],
    "tasks": [
    {
        "taskName": "build-all",
        "isBuildCommand": true,
        "showOutput": "silent",
        "problemMatcher": {
            "fileLocation": ["relative", "${workspaceRoot}"],
            "pattern": {
                "regexp": "^(.*)\\((.*),(.*)\\):\\s(error|warning)\\s(.*)$",
                "file": 1,
                "line": 2,
                "column": 3,
                "severity": 4,
                "message": 5
            }
        }
    }]
}
```

My Code version is 0.10.8

Thanks for a great project, and look forward to future updates :)

data.title: Snippet selection when pressing tab is not always correct
data.body:
I have an extension that exposes snippets for the [AVA](https://github.com/sindresorhus/ava) testing framework, called [vscode-ava](https://github.com/SamVerschueren/vscode-ava).

I expose the following snippet

``` json
"t.is()": {
    "prefix": "t.is",
    "body": "t.is(${1:value}, ${2:expected}${3:, '${4:message}'});",
    "description": "Assert that `value` is equal to `expected`"
}
```

This is what it looks when invoking the snippet

![snippet](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1913805/13553834/afb23912-e396-11e5-9605-5989cc4c425a.gif)

As you can see, it works for the first two values, but not for the message. It might be related with the message being optional and thus having the `,` inside `$3`.

data.title: Remove highlighting of "variable declaration" in rust highlighter
data.body:
Removes highlighting of "variable declaration". The pattern falsely assumes that ":" only occurs in type declarations. This is not true as it is also used when initializing a struct:

``` rust
Struct {
    member: 1 << 2
}
```

As the pattern also includes `type_params`, any `<` in the member initialization code breaks the highlighting of the rest of the file. I simply removed the patterns as it is quite tricky to distinguish these cases.

data.title: typescript.tsdk has confusing documentation and missing validly checks

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When a typescript file contains a [string literal type](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/wiki/What's-new-in-TypeScript#string-literal-types):

``` ts
let foo: "foo" | "bar" = "foo";

```

VSCode shows errors:

![foo_ts_-_simple-todos-react](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3731059/13551436/2eb22752-e33a-11e5-8748-c3a43dc858c8.jpg)

For example the [react ambient definition uses string literal types](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/blob/9f0f926a12026287b5a4a229e5672c01e7549313/react/react.d.ts#L507). Everything below the error is invalid.

Using typescript 1.8 as described in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3723#issuecomment-192342749 does not help.

![err](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3731059/13551459/f9081ef8-e33a-11e5-8e6f-e5a4da1f4d5c.jpg)

data.body:
When creating a code fence, the block doesn't get colored as code (stays white), but it does display as code in the preview.

    ```php
    <?php
    //Hello World
    echo ('Hello World!');
    ?>
    ```

If I tab the code with 4 spaces it does color it properly.

Here is an example:

![screenshot from 2016-03-05 16-45-51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1571806/13551042/cb698868-e2f1-11e5-90dc-6d83d7600fc8.png)

data.title: Virtual Documents and compareFileWith command

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I am attempting to modify the Git History extension to use virtual documents instead of temp files, but I am running into issues while executing the `workbench.files.action.compareFileWith` command.

If I open the virtual file first, then run the `compareFileWith` command, I get an error stating `Open a file first to compare it with another file.`, which would result from `workbenchEditorCommon.asFileEditorInput(this.editorService.getActiveEditorInput());` returning falsy.

Attempting the compare in reverse (open disk file, then compare, then open virtual file) I get an exception `Notification handler 'textDocument/publishDiagnostics' failed with message: Illegal argument: line must be positive` that appears to be caused by the fact that `babel-eslint` can't be loaded.

I haven't figured out how to debug the `GlobalCompareResourcesAction` directly yet, but I'll keep on digging. Also, is there a simple way to get a copy of the current call stack, so that I can post it here?

data.title: Allow setting a command event instead of an shortcut key in keybindings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi,

Would it be possible to set in the extension keybindings configuration an "command event" instead of a shortcut key ?

For example if i want bind the paste action i do

``` json
"keybindings": [{
  "command": "command.name",
  "key": "ctrl+v",
  "when": "editorTextFocus"
}]
```

with the "command event" setting, the user can change the default paste shortcut (for crazy reason :smile:) without affecting the extension behavior. This will

``` json
"keybindings": [{
  "command": "command.name",
  "on": "editor.action.clipboardPasteAction",
  "when": "editorTextFocus"
}]
```

I hope i was clear.
Thanks in advance.

data.title: "Queue" is not resolving
data.body:
Hi,
I am using Visual Studio on Mac (El Capitan) and it seems that "Queue" is not resolving, however when I run my program on Terminal, it works fine. it shows red squiggles under Queue, and Error: The value, constructor, namespace or type 'Queue' is not defined. But the code compiles and runs.
I thought it could be a bug and wanted to share it:

```
open System.Collections.Generic;;
type ListTree<'a> = Node of 'a * (ListTree<'a> list)
let bfIter f ltr =
    let todo = Queue<ListTree<'a>> ()
    todo.Enqueue ltr
    while(todo.Count <> 0) do
 let(Node(x,xs)) = todo.Dequeue()
        List.iter(todo.Enqueue) xs
        f x
```

OS X El Capitan (Version: 10.11.3) - Java Studio Code: Version 0.10.9 (0.10.9), ionide-fsharp 1.2.0
